meanings.definition: A state of agitation or excitement
meanings.sent1: The little girl was in a fuss before her birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The crowd was in a fuss waiting for the concert to start.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tail wagged in a fuss of joy.
meanings.sent4: The city was in a fuss of celebration after winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was in a fuss of anticipation before the surprise announcement.

meanings.definition: To show unnecessary or excessive concern
meanings.sent1: She would always fuss over her plants, making sure they had enough water.
meanings.sent2: The mother would fuss about her children's safety whenever they played outside.
meanings.sent3: He would fuss over his appearance before going on a date.
meanings.sent4: The chef would fuss over every detail of the dish before serving it to the customers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would fuss over the seating arrangement for the class trip to the museum.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with something in a fussy or overcomplicated way
meanings.sent1: She would fuss with the puzzle, trying to fit the pieces together perfectly.
meanings.sent2: He would fuss with the computer settings, making sure everything was just right.
meanings.sent3: The tailor would fuss with the measurements, ensuring the suit fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The artist would fuss with the details of the painting, adding intricate touches.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic would fuss with the engine, checking every part for any issues.
